name: Butterfly Stretch
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back with your legs spread wide apart, so that they form a V-shape.
2. Lift your chest and shoulders off the ground, so that you can see your toes or feel like you're stretching the full length of your body from head to heels.
3. Keeping your lower back pressed into the ground, bring one knee towards your chest while keeping your other leg extended on the ground.
4. Hold for a brief moment, feeling the stretch in your hips and thighs.
5. Slowly return your first leg to its original position, repeating with the other leg.
6. Continue alternating legs in this manner, bringing the opposite knee towards your chest each time you switch legs.
7. Repeat for 10-30 repetitions, or as many times as comfortable, focusing on maintaining a steady breath and gentle stretching motion throughout.
short_summary: The butterfly stretch is an exercise targeting the glutes, thighs, and lower back muscles, stretching while lying on your back with alternating leg movements.
